intro: Cleistanthus misamisensis, commonly known as the Misamis Bay cleistanthus, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in lowland forests and is often found in moist, well-drained soils. It is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its aesthetic appeal. However, it is also considered a rare species due to habitat loss and limited distribution.
